intro: Senecio parryi, commonly known as Parry's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow disk flowers that attract pollinators. Senecio parryi is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
